data.title: funcref() not working
data.body:
The wiki page on GDScript mentions there is a function funcref() to get a reference to an instance function. However, when I make this call:

funcref(self, "getRandomColor")

where "getRandomColor" is a valid function in self, then get the following error in the debugger:

Invalid call. Unexisting function 'funcref' in base Node

data.title: Simple 3d formats support
data.body:
Hi

It would be very nice if there is support for other 3d meshes like obj. 

One huge issue I have with collada is that when the user changes the original collada and reimports the collada file, every other changes and additions will be lost in the imported resource scene after the reimporting (or refreshing the resource scene if you will) This is very dangerous. Either imported collada scenes should not be editable or this system of integration should be disabled. I already lost couple of iterations in my projects due to reimporting. Maybe I am doing it the wrong way but I initially assumed that scene reimport should only update the mesh but that was not the case for me. Godot reimports everything and resets the resource scene.

data.title: Godot refuses to export if some imported resources have changed on the disk
data.body:
Hi

I am personally ok  how resource import works in general but it is a drag when Godot refuses to export my project to Android because some collada file changed on the disk. There is an indicator that shows that a mesh scene has changed next to the settings button.

data.title: Files are compiled by scons before dependencies are generated
data.body:
I've followed the following instructions to set up my environment:

http://pastebin.com/X3w9QYPP

I saw this problem previously with different headers, and a race condition between build processes has been eliminated as a potential cause.  What is generally happening is that cpp files or headers are compiled where headers not yet generated have been included.  Since this has been seen with multiple headers, it does not seem to be related to any one particular generated header but is rather an overall problem with scons beginning compilation before dependencies have been generated.

There is some documentation out there about this issue in other projects, but since I am not yet familiar enough with Godot's source (and in fact can't be until I can get it to build), learning scons just for this purpose would be a vain effort.  

Here's a case of the same problem occurring in another project: 

http://comments.gmane.org/gmane.comp.programming.tools.scons.user/22814

data.title: Nearest neighbor scaling for "stretch_2d"
data.body:
Hi

At the moment the "stretch_2d" option in the project settings makes bilinear stretching which makes everything look blurry and crappy in my view. It would be great if there are other options like "nearest pixel" and "cubic" scaling. 

I tried looking into code to find it but I am not able to clearly locate the responsible functions. I would be happy to dabble on it if someone points out where to look at.

thanks

data.title: In gdscript we cannot break long expressions in more than one line...
data.body:
Let's suppose I have a long "if" condition that I would want to "break" in more lines.

Example:

```
if (someLongCondition1 and someLongCondition2 or someLongCondition3):
    ...do something...
```

In Python you could do something like:

```
if (someLongCondition1 and
    someLongCondition2 or
    someLongCondition3):
   ...do something...
```

But in gdscript this doesn't work... In Python you could break lines with a "\" character too and in gdscript this doesn't work either. 

Of course, you could always do something like the following code, that will work in gdscript too:

```
var a = someLongCondition1
var b = someLongCondition2
var c = someLongCondition3
if (a and b or c):
   ...do something...
```

but, honestly, I wouldn't want having to define some variables (which very likely I will not use elsewhere in the code) only to split a long expression. 

I noticed that in gdscript you can split an array definition in this way:

```
myArray = [1, 2,
           3]
```

but you cannot split on more lines the parameters passed to a function, so actually this is not possible in gdscript:

```
myFunction(param1, param2,
           param3)
```

Being that gdscript is a Python-based language, maybe its parser should be more "Python"-like too.

data.title: Fixed #205 Race condition in build process
data.body:
- Set multi-jobs build option defaul to no
- Fixed #205

data.title: Race condition in build process
data.body:
I spent a week trying to track this issue down in the past, and gave up until somebody posted about their success getting Godot to build with MinGW/GCC + Python w/ scons on Windows.  I removed and installed everything fresh again, verified configuration, and downloaded the latest source to overwrite all my tinkering with scons.

What I find is that totally different headers are not found when their #include statement is reached during compilation.  On a hunch, I opened the task manager to watch it during the build, and sure enough it's multi-process.

It seems that headers are being included before they are done being built, which leads to a failure to compile; a race condition between the processes during the build.

Unfortunately, I am inadequately prepared to track down a fix, but with some pointers I'm willing to study to do further testing and try corrective measures.  Hopefully somebody out there is already familiar with this problem.

edit: I just tried building with antivirus disabled in case the file was in use by the scanner right after being built, and that's not it.  The missing header is also not present on-disk, which shows that it is actually not yet built when its #include is reached in compilation.  I just figured the test couldn't hurt just in case.

data.title: Strange behaviour for the signal "body_exit" of rigid bodies.
data.body:
I don't know if it's a bug, but really I don't understand this behaviour.
I have a RigidBody2D and a StaticBody2D in a scene file, as children of the main node (a Node2D):

```
+Node2D
  +RigidBody2D Top
    +Sprite
    +CollisionShape2D
  +StaticBody2D Bottom
    +Sprite
    +CollisionShape2D
```

For each RigidBody2D and StaticBody2D, let's define a CollisionShape2D with a RectangleShape2D shape type. We want to catch the collision of the top body with the bottom body, so let's activate the Contact Monitor property of the RigidBody2D and set Contacts Reported to 1.

In the editor, the two bodies are positioned one on top of the other and the scene starts with the one on top that falls down until it reach the static body on the bottom.

Let's define a script for the top rigid body:

```
extends RigidBody2D

func _ready():
    # Initalization here
    connect("body_enter", self, "_on_body_enter")
    connect("body_exit", self, "_on_body_exit")

func _on_body_enter(body):
    print("Top body enters in: " + body.get_name())
    set_linear_velocity(Vector2(0, -100))

func _on_body_exit(body):
    print("Top body exits from: " + body.get_name())
```

This script should display in the console window a message when the top body detects a collision with the static body on the bottom and another message when it exits from the collision area. When body_enter is triggered, the script makes the top body move up, so the two bodies should not be in collision anymore (until the top body doesn't go back down again) and it should be triggered the body_exit signal.

This works as expected but, strangely, if you set the "Contacts Reported" property of the top body to a value >= 2, only the first message is triggered (body_enter), as if the top body never left the collision area.
I noticed that if you change the shape type of the bottom body from RectangleShape2D to a CircleShape2D, CapsuleShape2D, RayShape2D or SegmentShape2D, the script triggers all the signals (body_enter and body_exit) as expected with every Contacts Reported value >=1.

Is this the normal behaviour? And if it's right, why body_exit doesn't trigger when Contacts Reported >= 2 ?

data.title: Mention .resize for arrays in the documentation
data.body: The documentation at https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/wiki/gdscript#array is misleading, as Array.resize is not mentioned. It implies that the arrays are fully dynamic and don't need a manual resize.

data.title: node.duplicate() fails on sprite->label structure
data.body:
(using Linux. I can not tell for other OS's) 

create a sprite called "Sprite", attach a label as child, then run

```
    s = get_node("Sprite")
    t = s.duplicate()
```

t will be null

data.title: Sprite.get_item_rect() returns wrong position
data.body:
I create a Sprite object like this:

```
var tex = get_resource(...)  # 50x50 pixels
var spr = Sprite.new()
add_child(spr)
spr.set_texture(tex)
spr.set_pos(Vector2(100, 100))  # or: spr.edit_set_rect(Rect2(Vector2(100, 100), tex.get_size()))
spr.show()

var rect = sprite.get_item_rect()
print(rect.pos, " - ", rect.size, " - ", rect.end)
```

This gives the following output:
0,0 - 50,50 - 50,50

Shouldn't the first Vector2 in the output ("pos") be 100,100?

data.title: Fixed issue #29 Editor doesn't support CJK
data.body:
Editor now support CJK display
- Add Build option (scons cjk=yes) to bundle DroidSansFallback (34328 unicode chars) as default font to support CJK display;  
- Add loading compressed editor font support, reduce debug build size form 28M to 15M
- Add loading multi-page editor font support  (1x 4096-> 6x1024)

Nextstep:
- More control of CJK build size
- Dynamic font support (Runtime TTF)
- Multi-language editor
- IME support on Mac/Linux

data.title: Valid XML Tileset: Error loading file: Not a resource!
data.body:
The bug #135 was fixed, no doubt on that. But I keep getting this error with my automagically generated XML tileset files!

![captura de pantalla de 2014-03-11 16 10 45](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1055216/2391532/3d08bc8c-a96a-11e3-8f76-939c83c7dbb9.png)

Maybe my tool is doing something wrong, after all, I read one XML file generated by Godot for a tile set and just imitate what I saw to generate the file on my application. So I request a revision of the built-in XML parser, or some guidance on how to write the XML tileset file correctly. And a more clear error message.

To make easy the testing part, I bring some tiles with their respective automagically generated XML file that you can [download from here](http://deshackra.com/tiles.zip)

cheers!
